unnormalised: The Indian government has mandated linking of PAN (Permanent Account Number) with Aadhaar card for all taxpayers. The deadline is fast approaching, with penalties applicable post 31/03/2024. Failure to comply can lead to the PAN becoming inoperative, affecting financial transactions. This directive impacts individuals, HUFs (Hindu Undivided Families), and companies registered under various acts.

The deadline is fast approaching, with penalties applicable post thirty first March two thousand and twenty four. Failure to comply can lead to the P-A-N becoming inoperative, affecting financial transactions. This directive impacts individuals, H-U-Fs (Hindu Undivided Families), and companies registered under various acts.

normalised: For businesses, linking C-I-N (Corporate Identification Number) with P-A-N and T-A-N (Tax Deduction and Collection Account Number) is also crucial for smooth G-S-T (Goods and Services Tax) operations. G-S-T-I-N numbers beginning with 'twenty seven' are common in Maharashtra, but linking details across states is essential. unnormalised: Remember to verify your linked status on the income tax portal using your PAN and Aadhaar details. Enter your date of birth in DD/MM/YYYY format. Any discrepancy should be rectified at the earliest to avoid disruptions. It is a good idea to cross-reference your PAN details with your TAN database, especially if your TAN starts with a 'D'.
